class.name: Phaser.State
class.help: This is a base State class which can be extended if you are creating your own game.\nIt provides quick access to common functions such as the camera, cache, input, match, sound and more.

public.name: create
public.help: create is called once preload has completed, this includes the loading of any assets from the Loader.\nIf you don't have a preload method then create is the first method called in your State.

public.name: loadRender
public.help: loadRender is called during the Loader process. This only happens if you've set one or more assets to load in the preload method.\nThe difference between loadRender and render is that any objects you render in this method you must be sure their assets exist.

public.name: loadUpdate
public.help: loadUpdate is called during the Loader process. This only happens if you've set one or more assets to load in the preload method.

public.name: pauseUpdate
public.help: pauseUpdate is called while the game is paused instead of preUpdate, update and postUpdate.

public.name: paused
public.help: This method will be called if the core game loop is paused.

public.name: preload
public.help: preload is called first. Normally you'd use this to load your game assets (or those needed for the current State)\nYou shouldn't create any objects in this method that require assets that you're also loading in this method, as\nthey won't yet be available.

public.name: render
public.help: Nearly all display objects in Phaser render automatically, you don't need to tell them to render.\nHowever the render method is called AFTER the game renderer and plugins have rendered, so you're able to do any\nfinal post-processing style effects here. Note that this happens before plugins postRender takes place.

public.name: resize
public.help: If your game is set to Scalemode RESIZE then each time the browser resizes it will call this function, passing in the new width and height.

public.name: shutdown
public.help: This method will be called when the State is shutdown (i.e. you switch to another state from this one).

public.name: update
public.help: The update method is left empty for your own use.\nIt is called during the core game loop AFTER debug, physics, plugins and the Stage have had their preUpdate methods called.\nIf is called BEFORE Stage, Tweens, Sounds, Input, Physics, Particles and Plugins have had their postUpdate methods called.

public.name: add
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the GameObjectFactory which can be used to add new objects to the World.

public.name: cache
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the game cache which contains any loaded or generated assets, such as images, sound and more.

public.name: game
public.inlineHelp: This is a reference to the currently running Game.

public.name: input
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the Input Manager.

public.name: load
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the Loader, which you mostly use in the preload method of your state to load external assets.

public.name: make
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the GameObjectCreator which can be used to make new objects.

public.name: math
public.inlineHelp: A reference to Math class with lots of helpful functions.

public.name: particles
public.inlineHelp: The Particle Manager. It is called during the core gameloop and updates any Particle Emitters it has created.

public.name: physics
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the physics manager which looks after the different physics systems available within Phaser.

public.name: rnd
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the seeded and repeatable random data generator.

public.name: scale
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the Scale Manager which controls the way the game scales on different displays.

public.name: sound
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the Sound Manager which can create, play and stop sounds, as well as adjust global volume.

public.name: time
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the game clock and timed events system.

public.name: tweens
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the tween manager.

public.name: world
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the game world. All objects live in the Game World and its size is not bound by the display resolution.
